neshoba-general-hospital.name: Neshoba General Hospital

millinocket-regional-hospital.notes: Independent 501(c)(3) CAH serving the Katahdin region; founded 1952, CAH designation since 2002.

copley-hospital.name: Copley Hospital
copley-hospital.notes: Independent nonprofit CAH serving Lamoille County since 1932; recognized as Top 100 CAH.

cuba-memorial-hospital.name: Cuba Memorial Hospital
cuba-memorial-hospital.notes: Independent nonprofit CAH in rural Allegany County; also operates a 61-bed skilled nursing facility.

lane-county-hospital.notes: County-owned CAH serving Lane County; NRHA Top 20 CAH for Quality

decatur-county-hospital.name: Decatur County Hospital

barrett-hospital.name: Barrett Hospital & HealthCare
barrett-hospital.notes: Top 100 CAH awardee, serves Southwest Montana's Beaverhead County

rio-grande-hospital.name: Rio Grande Hospital
rio-grande-hospital.notes: Operated by Valley Citizens' Foundation for Healthcare; clinics in Creede, South Fork, and Monte Vista

columbia-memorial-hospital.name: Columbia Memorial Hospital
columbia-memorial-hospital.notes: One of five remaining independent hospitals in Oregon; Planetree Gold certified; partnership with OHSU for specialty services

fallon-medical-complex.name: Fallon Medical Complex

holy-cross-hospital-taos.name: Holy Cross Hospital
holy-cross-hospital-taos.notes: Member of New Mexico Rural Hospital Network; first in NM to offer HeartFlow Plaque Analysis

gritman-medical-center.name: Gritman Medical Center
gritman-medical-center.notes: Largest private employer in Latah County; multiple quality and patient experience awards

dhr-health.name: DHR Health

hillcrest-claremore.name: Hillcrest Hospital Claremore
hillcrest-claremore.notes: Part of Hillcrest HealthCare System, a regional for-profit network of 7 hospitals in northeastern Oklahoma, owned by Ardent Health Services.

scenic-mountain-medical-center.name: Scenic Mountain Medical Center

carolina-pines-rmc.name: Carolina Pines Regional Medical Center

mayers-memorial-hospital.name: Mayers Memorial Hospital District
mayers-memorial-hospital.notes: Public hospital district in rural northeastern California; 16 acute care beds plus skilled nursing facility

lincoln-hospital-davenport.name: Lincoln Hospital
lincoln-hospital-davenport.notes: Operated by Lincoln County Hospital District #3; serves rural eastern Washington

cordova-community-medical-center.name: Cordova Community Medical Center
cordova-community-medical-center.notes: City-owned hospital serving remote coastal Alaska community; 13 acute care beds

community-health-centers-burlington.name: Community Health Centers of Burlington
community-health-centers-burlington.notes: Largest FQHC in the Burlington area; provides primary care, dental, behavioral health, and substance abuse services across multiple sites in Chittenden County.

fenway-health.name: Fenway Health

addabbo-family-health-center.name: Joseph P. Addabbo Family Health Center
addabbo-family-health-center.notes: Multi-site FQHC serving Queens and Brooklyn communities; provides adult/family medicine, dental, behavioral health, pediatrics, and women's health.

penobscot-community-health-care.name: Penobscot Community Health Care
penobscot-community-health-care.notes: Largest FQHC in Maine; provides primary care, dental, behavioral health, and pharmacy services across multiple sites in the Greater Bangor area.

philadelphia-fight.name: Philadelphia FIGHT Community Health Centers
philadelphia-fight.notes: FQHC providing primary care, dental, behavioral health, and HIV/Hepatitis C specialty care; serves diverse urban populations with sliding fee scale.

community-health-center-ct.name: Community Health Center, Inc.
community-health-center-ct.notes: One of the largest FQHCs in Connecticut, serving over 145,000 patients; provides primary care, dental, and behavioral health across multiple locations statewide. Founded 1972.

centracare-long-prairie.name: CentraCare  Long Prairie Hospital
centracare-long-prairie.notes: CAH and Level IV trauma center within CentraCare, a regional nonprofit system serving central Minnesota with 9 hospitals.

avera-hand-county-memorial.name: Avera Hand County Memorial Hospital
avera-hand-county-memorial.notes: 25-bed CAH affiliated with Avera Health, a regional nonprofit system headquartered in Sioux Falls, SD serving five Upper Midwest states.

essentia-health-fosston.name: Essentia Health-Fosston
essentia-health-fosston.notes: 25-bed CAH within Essentia Health, a regional nonprofit integrated health system based in Duluth, MN serving communities across MN, WI, and ND.

el-centro-de-corazon.name: El Centro de Corazn
el-centro-de-corazon.notes: Founded 1994, serves Houston's East End with primary care, dental, behavioral health; English/Spanish services

hopehealth.name: HopeHealth
hopehealth.notes: Founded 1991, FQHC since 2007; serves Florence and surrounding counties with integrated medical, dental, and behavioral health

aaron-e-henry-chc.name: Aaron E. Henry Community Health Services Center
aaron-e-henry-chc.notes: Founded 1979, serves Mississippi Delta across 12 sites in 6 rural counties; over 90% of patients below 200% FPL

franklin-primary-health-center.name: Franklin Primary Health Center
franklin-primary-health-center.notes: Founded 1975, Patient-Centered Medical Home serving Mobile community with primary care, dental, and behavioral health

crescentcare.name: CrescentCare
crescentcare.notes: Formerly NO/AIDS Task Force; provides whole-person care with focus on LGBTQ+ community, HIV services, and underserved populations

east-georgia-healthcare-center.name: East Georgia Healthcare Center
east-georgia-healthcare-center.notes: Serves 13 counties across rural Southeast Georgia with primary care, dental, pharmacy, optometry, and behavioral health

cherokee-health-systems.name: Cherokee Health Systems
cherokee-health-systems.notes: Founded 1960, rebranded to River Valley Health in 2025; nationally recognized integrated primary care and behavioral health model serving East Tennessee

abbeville-area-medical-center.name: Abbeville Area Medical Center
abbeville-area-medical-center.notes: Independent nonprofit CAH serving rural Abbeville County since 1963; recognized for quality and patient satisfaction.

bath-community-hospital.name: Bath Community Hospital
bath-community-hospital.notes: Independent unaffiliated nonprofit CAH established 1916; only full-service hospital within 25-mile radius in the Virginia Highlands.

pocahontas-memorial-hospital.name: Pocahontas Memorial Hospital

wayne-county-hospital.name: Wayne County Hospital

minnie-hamilton-health-system.name: Minnie Hamilton Health System

erie-family-health-centers.name: Erie Family Health Centers
erie-family-health-centers.notes: Large urban FQHC serving 86,000+ patients across 13 locations in Chicagoland; founded 1957

neighborhood-health-association.notes: Multi-site FQHC in Toledo; operates clinics including homeless health services since 1984

heartland-community-health-center.name: Heartland Community Health Center

community-health-center-central-missouri.name: Community Health Center of Central Missouri
community-health-center-central-missouri.notes: FQHC serving central Missouri with clinics in Jefferson City, Fulton, California, and Linn; established 2005

northlakes-community-clinic.name: NorthLakes Community Clinic
northlakes-community-clinic.notes: Rural FQHC operating ~20 clinics across 13 counties in northern Wisconsin

peoples-health-centers.name: Betty Jean Kerr People's Health Centers
peoples-health-centers.notes: Urban FQHC serving St. Louis metro area since 1972; Joint Commission accredited

virginia-garcia-memorial-health-center.name: Virginia Garcia Memorial Health Center
virginia-garcia-memorial-health-center.notes: Founded to serve migrant farmworker communities; serves over 50,000 patients annually in Washington County

el-rio-health.name: El Rio Health
el-rio-health.notes: One of the largest FQHCs in the nation; serves roughly 1 in 10 Tucson residents across 14 clinics

la-clinica-de-la-raza.name: La Clnica de La Raza
la-clinica-de-la-raza.notes: Serving the Bay Area since 1971; provides primary care, dental, and behavioral health to underserved communities

sea-mar-community-health-centers.name: Sea Mar Community Health Centers
sea-mar-community-health-centers.notes: Founded 1978 to serve Latino community; now over 90 clinics across western Washington

anchorage-neighborhood-health-center.name: Anchorage Neighborhood Health Center
anchorage-neighborhood-health-center.notes: Alaska's largest independent FQHC; provides care in 56 languages; over 51 years of service

northwest-colorado-health.name: Northwest Colorado Health
northwest-colorado-health.notes: Serving frontier and rural communities in northwest Colorado since 1964

nevada-health-centers.name: Nevada Health Centers
nevada-health-centers.notes: Largest provider of care for uninsured/underinsured in Nevada; 18+ locations statewide since 1977

duly-health-and-care.name: Duly Health and Care
duly-health-and-care.notes: Largest independent multi-specialty physician group in the Midwest; 1,000+ providers across 150+ locations in IL and IN; formerly DuPage Medical Group

the-iowa-clinic.name: The Iowa Clinic
the-iowa-clinic.notes: Largest physician-owned multi-specialty group in Central Iowa; 250+ providers across 40+ specialties and 15 locations

esse-health.name: Esse Health
esse-health.notes: Independent physician-owned multi-specialty group; 100+ physicians across 45+ offices in the St. Louis metro area

mankato-clinic.name: Mankato Clinic
mankato-clinic.notes: Independent physician-owned multi-specialty practice since 1916; 180+ providers across 13 locations in southern Minnesota

advocare.name: Advocare, LLC
advocare.notes: One of the largest independent multi-specialty physician groups in NJ/PA/DE with 900+ providers across 270+ care centers

schweiger-dermatology-group.name: Schweiger Dermatology Group
schweiger-dermatology-group.notes: Largest dermatology practice in the Northeast with 160+ offices across NY, NJ, CT, and PA; 600+ providers

ent-allergy-associates.name: ENT & Allergy Associates, LLP
ent-allergy-associates.notes: Largest ENT, allergy, and audiology practice in the US with 450+ clinicians across 80+ offices in NY, NJ, and PA

consensus-health.name: Consensus Health
consensus-health.notes: Physician-owned independent multi-specialty group with 170+ providers across nearly 60 practices in 18 NJ counties

valley-medical-group.name: Valley Medical Group
valley-medical-group.notes: Independent multi-specialty practice in Western MA offering primary care, pediatrics, surgery, behavioral health, and radiology; independent since 2000

western-washington-medical-group.name: Western Washington Medical Group
western-washington-medical-group.notes: Provider-owned independent multi-specialty group, 100+ providers in 20+ specialties across Snohomish, Skagit, Island, and Whatcom counties

arizona-community-physicians.name: Arizona Community Physicians
arizona-community-physicians.notes: Largest independent physician-owned multi-specialty group in Tucson, founded 1994, primary and specialty care across Southern Arizona

boulder-medical-center.name: Boulder Medical Center
boulder-medical-center.notes: Independent physician-owned for-profit multi-specialty group since 1949, 80+ providers across five locations in Boulder County

proliance-surgeons.name: Proliance Surgeons
proliance-surgeons.notes: Large independent physician-owned for-profit surgical specialty group, 250+ physicians, 100+ care centers across Washington state

ironwood-cancer-research-centers.name: Ironwood Cancer & Research Centers
ironwood-cancer-research-centers.notes: Independent physician-owned for-profit oncology practice, 100+ providers across 14+ locations in metropolitan Phoenix

us-dermatology-partners.name: U.S. Dermatology Partners
us-dermatology-partners.notes: PE-backed (Abry Partners) dermatology network; HQ in Dallas with 50+ TX locations across 8 states

gi-alliance.name: GI Alliance
gi-alliance.notes: PE-backed (Apollo Global) gastroenterology network; one of the largest independent GI groups in the U.S.

eyesouth-partners.name: EyeSouth Partners
eyesouth-partners.notes: PE-backed (Olympus Partners) ophthalmology network; 60+ practices, 400+ doctors, 276+ locations across the South

texas-oncology.name: Texas Oncology
texas-oncology.notes: Part of US Oncology Network (McKesson); largest community oncology practice in TX

orthocarolina.name: OrthoCarolina
orthocarolina.notes: Physician-owned independent orthopedic group, 133 physicians, 1600 employees, 30+ clinics across the Carolinas, over 1M patient visits/year

gastro-florida.name: Gastro Florida
gastro-florida.notes: Physician-owned independent gastroenterology practice, 50+ providers, 25+ locations across Tampa Bay, founded 2010

alabama-medical-group.name: Alabama Medical Group
alabama-medical-group.notes: Largest independently owned multi-specialty practice in Mobile, founded 1946, 200+ employees, specialties include family medicine, internal medicine, neurology, rheumatology

southeast-medical-group.name: Southeast Medical Group
southeast-medical-group.notes: Largest independent medical group in the Southeast, physician-owned, 160+ providers, 50+ primary care locations across Georgia, Alabama, and Tennessee

baton-rouge-clinic.name: The Baton Rouge Clinic
baton-rouge-clinic.notes: Physician-owned multi-specialty clinic since 1946, 20+ specialties, serves 250,000+ patients in the Baton Rouge area

lexington-clinic.name: Lexington Clinic
lexington-clinic.notes: Central Kentucky's largest and oldest private physician-owned multi-specialty group, founded 1920, ~200 providers, 30+ specialties, 25+ locations

prevea-health.name: Prevea Health
prevea-health.notes: Physician-owned, 501(c)(3) nonprofit multispecialty group practice with 200+ physicians across 60+ specialties and 50+ locations. Partners with HSHS hospitals but is independently owned and governed.

ghc-south-central-wisconsin.name: Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin
ghc-south-central-wisconsin.notes: Member-owned nonprofit cooperative (501(c)(3)) operating multiple clinics in the Madison area with employed physicians. Staff-model HMO founded in 1972 serving 70,000+ members.

olmsted-medical-center.name: Olmsted Medical Center
olmsted-medical-center.notes: Independent, physician-led 501(c)(3) nonprofit multispecialty group practice with 290+ clinicians across 35+ specialties and 25+ locations in southeastern Minnesota. Also operates a 61-bed community hospital.
